sentences.en: He and his associate people ground jolt wears silent silence.
sentences.cn: 他和他的伙伴们默无声息地颠簸着.

sentences.en: He gave these scoundrels a jolt.
sentences.cn: 他给这些恶棍以当头一棒.

sentences.en: I putthe brakes on suddenly and the car stopped with a jolt.
sentences.cn: 我突然刹车,车子颠簸了一下停住了.

sentences.en: I was prepared mentally but it was impossible not to a jolt.
sentences.cn: 我虽然已有心理准备,但却不可能不受到震动.

sentences.en: Please pour me a jolt of whisky.
sentences.cn: 请给我倒一点威士忌提提神好吗?

sentences.en: The bad news gave us a jolt.
The bus stopped with a jolt.
sentences.cn: 公共汽车一蹦停了下来.

sentences.en: The jolt caused many slips and a few spills.
sentences.cn: 颠簸让许多东西滑倒并且使一些液体溅出.

sentences.en: The news of the accident gave her an unpleasant jolt / quite a jolt.
sentences.cn: 她听到出事的消息吃了一惊[大吃一惊].

sentences.en: The sudden jolt plunged her forward.
sentences.cn: 突然颠了一下,她向前打了个趔趄.

sentences.en: The truck started with a jolt.
sentences.cn: 大卡车发动时摇晃了一下.

sentences.en: They were working frantically in the fear that an aftershock would jolt the house again.
sentences.cn: 他们拼命地干着，担心余震可能会使房子再次受到震动。

sentences.en: We jolted along rough wet roads through an endless banana plantation.
sentences.cn: 我们沿崎岖潮湿的公路颠簸着驶过无边无际的香蕉种植园。

sentences.en: We were worried that one tiny jolt could worsen her injuries.
sentences.cn: 我们担心稍微颠簸一下就可能会使她的伤势恶化。

sentences.en: When our plane landed in the storm, it hit the runway with a jolt.
sentences.cn: 我们的飞机在暴风雨中着陆时, 颠簸着落在地上.

sentences.en: With a tremendous jolt the car started.
sentences.cn: 汽车狠狠摇晃一下才起动了.

trans.tran_cn: 颠簸，摇，震惊，严重挫折，震惊，引起震惊的事情，突然的猛击，意外的挫折

trans.tran_en: to move suddenly and roughly, or to make someone or something move in this way
to move suddenly and roughly, or to make someone or something move in this way

trans.tran_cn: （使）摇动，（使）震惊，使震惊，使颠簸
